attributes.action: let parents choose between themselves which of them should be paid to stay at home; if a law to enable parents to do this is brought in
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Just because it is women who give birth it doesn't necessarily follow that all women have the aptitude or capability to care for the resultant child; any capable (and, above all, loving) person can do that.  It seems to me that if the child's primary carer has been coerced into this by societal expectations, rather than choosing to do it, her (or his) relationship with the child will be one of resentment, rather than love, to the detriment of the child at least as much as, if not more so than, the carer her/himself.
